text: the reason I talk about Henry David
thorough in the book who seems to be
really A unlikely digital philosopher
because he his reputation is that he ran
away from civilization and ran away from
technology when he built his cabin at
Walden Pond and he's in The Stereotype
he's the Great Escape Artist but in fact
thorough was not escaping civilization
at Walden and the reason I use him is
that he built that cabin as an
experiment in in Striking a balance not
in disconnecting but in putting himself
just a short distance from civilization
and going back and forth a lot to see if
he could make that work he was a very
short walk from the village of conquered
Mass where he spent most of his life he
was back and forth all the time he
entertained as many as 30 people in that
little cabin at one time during the two
years that he wrote the famous Walden so
he was in many ways like us you know
trying to wrestle with in his time the
new connectedness which was the
telegraph the railroad all these devices
that were making life busier and more
hectic and his basic message that I
think is so valuable today is that we
all need to set up these zones where
we're relatively less connected where we
can go back inward um and sort of take
all that outward richness that we're
pulling in and doing something do
something with it do something fresh and
creative with it he has a wonderful
quote where he says um another issue in
his time in tho time was Believe It or
Not addiction to the post office to
checking your mail too often and he says
Theo writes at one point in proportion
as a man's inward life fails he goes
back more desperately and constantly to
the post office and he said and he adds
you can be sure that the man who walks
away with the greatest number of letters
has not heard from himself in a long
time it's a wonderful sort of diagnosis
of what we're facing today the more
addicted you are to that outward col
connected life the less you're getting
out of it inwardly and it's just a
matter of striking a healthier balance
so that's one of the reasons I use
thorough as a sort of wonderful example
of finding those zones where we can
strike a better balance for ourselves
